sentences.english: A drunken man shambled along the street.
The drunken man lurched along toward me.
sentences.chinese: 一个喝醉酒的人沿街踉跄而行。

sentences.english: He totters and falls into the arms of Roxane and his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他踉踉跄跄倒在了罗克珊和他朋友们的手中。

sentences.english: Without light, they grope in the dark and stagger like drunkards.
sentences.chinese: 在无光的黑暗中摸索，踉跄犹如醉汉。

sentences.english: Six men shambled out, looking confused and bewildered.
sentences.chinese: 六个男人踉跄着走出来，看起来困惑极了。

sentences.english: The wolf leaped lamely back, losing its footing and falling in its weakness.
sentences.chinese: 那狼正踉跄着往回跳，因为虚弱一下失足跌倒在地。

sentences.english: The old man faltered toward the door-way in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 老人摸黑踉踉跄跄地朝门口走去。

sentences.english: The old man's hands trembled, his eyesight was blurred, and his step faltered.
sentences.chinese: 老人的双手惊怖，眼睛昏花，步履也已踉跄。

sentences.english: Mrs Schnible opened her door and hobbled into the hall.
sentences.chinese: 史妮波女士打开房门，踉踉跄跄的跑到大厅。

sentences.english: At the first round he was rocked by John.
sentences.chinese: 他在第一回合时就被约翰打得踉踉跄跄。

sentences.english: He reeled and swayed, doddering like a drunken man to keep from falling.
sentences.chinese: 他左摇右摆，像醉汉踉跄着，努力不让自己摔倒。

sentences.english: The old man bumble along the road.
Stumbling out the door, I headed home in a daze, walking alone in the middle of the night.
sentences.chinese: 踉跄地走出门，我一个人在半夜昏昏沉沉地赶回家去。

sentences.english: Witnesses describe seeing him stumbling and looking glazed.
sentences.chinese: 目击证人称看见他脚步踉跄，神情呆滞。

sentences.english: I rose groggily to my feet and faced the impossible once more.
sentences.chinese: 我踉踉跄跄地站起身来又一次面对那无法思议的行程。

sentences.english: Falteringly she took out a match and lit it.
sentences.chinese: 踉跄她拿出火柴扑灭它。

definition: to stagger/to stumble/to reel/Taiwan pr. [lie4 ju1]
to recoil/to draw back/to fall back/to retreat
rolling and crawling/trying frantically to escape (idiom)
to fall flat on one's face
to fall flat on one's face (vulgar)
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
to walk unsteadily/to stagger/to lurch/to hobble/to totter
(onom.) sound of object falling into water/plop
in a great rush/in a flurry
